info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 3:37PM CDT until July 13 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Henderson. In north central Texas, Navarro.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Athens, Gun Barrel City, Mabank, Chandler, Malakoff, Tool, Kerens, Seven Points, Brownsboro, Eustace, Berryville, Trinidad, Edom, Enchanted Oaks, Caney City, Forest Grove Reservoir, Coon Creek Lake, Trinidad Lake, Purtis Creek State Park and Cedar Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING
